body_content.explanation: the part of a planet's atmosphere in which there are many ions (= atoms or groups of atoms that have an electrical charge):
examples: Some sorts of plasmoid life may exist in planetary ionospheres or interstellar space.

body_content.explanation: the part of the earth's atmosphere, from about 60 kilometres to about 1,000 kilometres above the surface, in which there are many ions (= atoms or groups of atoms that have an electrical charge):
examples: Altering the temperature of the ionosphere can affect the chemical reactions that produce ozone.
Microwaves are able to pass through the ionosphere to reach satellites in space.
